intro: Cyrtosiphonia madurensis, commonly known as the Madurese sea lettuce, is a species of red algae belonging to the family Rhodomelaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, branching thallus that ranges from green to reddish in color. This marine plant typically grows in shallow coastal waters, where it attaches to rocks or other substrates. Cyrtosiphonia madurensis plays a role in marine ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms. Its morphology and ecological significance make it an important subject in studies of marine botany.
